intro: Setaria onurus f. ramulosa, commonly known as the slender false panicgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a fibrous root system and is adapted to survive in regions with low moisture availability. Its morphology makes it distinguishable from other species within the Setaria genus.
